body.p:
Louisville Nov 18th/60
A. G. Hodges
Dr Sir

Will you be so kind as to interpose with the Govenor in my behalf for a remission of the fine rendered last Jany term of the Criminal Court, for $500. x/00 You will remember I obtained a respite hoping to be able to pay but Business has been such I find it Impossible to do so the fine was on a bail Bond for one J. H. Miller who there is no doubt was killed at the Battle of Shilo his widow has nothing except what she is able to make by her own industry with 4 small children to support I send the respite hopeing to obtain a remission for the states portion
over
I really cannot afford to come up but if necessary will do so. please attend to it soon and let me know my fate
